pull.title: Make mining fee policy match relay fee policy.
pull.body: This resolves a case in which a mismatch could be used to bloat up the mempool by sending transactions that pay enough fee to relay, but not to be mined, with the default policies.

events.message:
Make mining fee policy match relay fee policy.

This resolves a case in which a mismatch could be used to bloat up the
mempool by sending transactions that pay enough fee to relay, but not
to be mined, with the default policies.

events.body: ACK, but lets not forget to mention this in the release notes.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/037b4f1485404a69f96ac6c448a97d21315c8663 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
Shouldn't this PR apply to `0.9.0` branch so it can then be merged up into master?

We have a policy of only pulling in changes in side branches that have been merged into master, just to make reasoning easier of what is where. This means that pull requests should always be for master (well, perhaps except for readme/release notes specific to a release).
Correct.  Default is "upstream first" (==master), then backport.  This helps ensure bug fixes are not lost.

issue.title: Testnet fix
issue.body:
Testnet is not working.  This series of patches gets it back working.  Summary:
1.  Pulled sipa's redundant insert patch from Bitcoin to get OSX builds working.
2.  Stoped Bitcoin icon showing on Mac dock, by replacing with Bob's Bitcoin icon.
3.  Cleaned up coingen genesis mess, so i could:
4.  Mine new testnet genesis block, so that I could then:
5.  Get testnet working.
6.  Added proper doc/release-process.md, for guidelines on building wallets & release process

All of this is of course to be able to test out new difficulty algorithms for BOB, without messing with the main network.  I've build & tested this code for OSX, Windows and Linux, & feel quite confident it is sound.  No hard fork, no big changes, just cleanup and fixes to broken shit.

Also, regardless of what the difficulty algorithm will be in the future, all of this needs to be in place.  So, merge this, and this will be the base for the difficulty adjustment algorithm switch to be dropped on top of.

events.body:
Would be nice to move nMinTxFee constant to wallet.cpp/h at some point, as it now only affects the wallet.

After this commit there is only one use of nMinTxFee remaining outside wallet.cpp and the options parsing, in GetMinFee ( https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/main.cpp#L781 ).
Merged into master and 0.9.0 (and doc/release-notes.md in the 0.9.0 branch updated).

issue.title: [Wallet] Reduce minTxFee for transaction creation to 1000 satoshis
issue.body: Make minTxFee match minRelayTxFee one year after #3305

issue.title: Restore minimum feerate to 10000 satoshis
issue.body:
Only the minimum relay fee was intended to be reduced to 1000 satoshis, but due to mempool bugs, nodes can't handle divergent relay and mining fee rates properly yet.
A quick workaround was merged for 0.9 by using the relay fee for mining (PR #3838), but without any consensus for the actual mining default to be dropped.
Unfortunately, many miners seem to still run with default policies, and this fee rate makes spamming too cheap still.
This brings the minimum fee rate back to up 10000 satoshis, which reflects the last consensus for standard mining fee rate.
